reviews.text: Venue of great historical value. If you are from Belgrade or you are visiting Belgrade this place has to be on your site seeing map 🗺️
Place you must see!👌

The Royal Castle itself (especially one of its two building) is nice and has nice interior. However, some things disapointed us: Tours take place just on Saturday and Sunday, twice a day only, only in Serbian. Moreover, you have to come to the Tourist info center prior to the tour to buy tickets (!) (No chance to do it online) and provide them with  passport numbers (!). The tour itself goes into detail, well...too much :-) Many times, single pieces of art were extensively commented what is nice, but it makes you tired as the tour lasts 2 hours (in 2 relatively small buildings). The most important info for Tourists, however, is that there are no tours in English.
Great room
Not accepting individual visits. One has to join a guided tour from downtown. And it only opens on Saturdays and Sundays from 11am to 2pm.
Beautiful old building...
Belgrade is amazing city with alot of history. must see
yea it Hassan , but really naeedds manicure (plz xD)
Ok
Belgrade sightseeing day & night new palace

It's quite an imposing place, maybe not easy to be a tourist in it, since you may disturb somebody, but as long as you don't rush around it's basically enjoyable. I think they had some sort of sound system with orthodox music on (reeeeally quiet) which added an extra bit of solemnity.

The Cathedral Church in Belgrade is located at the crossroads of the leaders of the Prince Sime Markovic and King Peter. On the site of today's church there was an older one, dedicated to the Holy Archangel Michael. The church church as a stationary cultural asset has the status of a cultural monument of exceptional importance, by the decision of 1979.

With its architecture, artwork and rich treasury, it is an exceptional cultural monument. It is an invaluable historical heritage related to the fate of Serbian Belgrade of the first half of the 19th century, which just formed in the area around the Church of the Sabor, becoming its church, administrative and cultural center. At a time when new social and political circumstances in Serbia are gradually emerging, the Saborna Church has become the head of the struggle for the independence from Turkish centralism until the final liberation from centuries of slavery.
Very nice and holy place
The most interesting church in Belgrad for me
Beautiful historical place to visit.
Amazing place
Amazing orthodox temple! It's a must visit!

Against the northeast walls of the Belgrade Fortress sits the oldest church in the city.

The exact origins of the building are unknown, except that its history is a litany of demolitions and rebuilds.

The earliest mention is from the 1400s, but it was duly pulled down after the Ottoman Empire conquered Belgrade in 1521. The current building is from the 19th century (requiring a restoration after WWI) and integrates walls from the fort’s old gunpowder magazine.

The facade is clad with ivy, and the interior has some peculiar chandeliers made from First World War bayonet blades and shell casings.
Cpd “thecrazytourist “
Really pretty church in a unique surroundings with its own atmosphere
One of the best churches that I have seen
I baptised my child in here. Perfect, historical and peacefull.
It was surely a holy place and full of positive energy.
Nice👍👍
Nice
Heritage to respect
Amazing orthodox temple. You can rest and buy some souvenirs. Some of the most important patriarchs are burried here. You should definitely visit and pay your respect.
Old Monastery located at peaceful place with a big parking lot, also bus 47 🚍 station is in front of monastery. There is a grave of one of serbian most loved church leaders Patrijarh Pavle.
Quiet peacefull place...
Beautiful place, my recomend. I was there with my mom, this spring.
Ok
Only mosque in Belgrade, beautifully built in Ottoman period
Nice mosque in downtown Belgrad!
Its nicely protected Turkish heritage.
Amazing structure internally, beautiful Salah acustics from this historic mosque
Nice place. Stuff is really professional.

Very small museum, cool knowledgeable guides that seem to master a lot of the countrie's historic, traditional and mythological stories. In an hour you can see most part of it. There is a little shop outside of the museum where you can buy some artifacts that are also available elsewhere at lesser price.
I like this place but I would love it if it had enough traditional and local object. I think it doesn't represent enough the national heritage

I loved visiting this museum. I wish I could've taken pictures. Nevertheless, our tour guide, William Dayo, was very well versed in each of the exhibits. It was really nice to have someone with us who gave us in depth information on what we were viewing. It gave us a deeper understanding and appreciation for each of the artifacts.
It was nice. The museum has a lot to offer in cultural history and I was happy to see them opened on a Sunday.

This museum continues the tradition of equating Western African culture and history mainly with masks (sarcasm). It could almost be interchangeable with the museum's in Dakar and Bamako except they both have a second floor dedicated to textiles. 

Granted, the masks are interesting and high quality, but they are completely decontextualized with cryptic captions an little explanation tying anything together.

There is one table showing the evolution of money that was nice. 

It's one of the few times I wished there was a museum gift shop with some books. 

Weirdly they don't allow photography either, as if history should be hidden. 

Avoid the restaurant out back it is way overpriced and there are better maquis around.
Here you can see breaf ortodox christian mid century art
Closed for visiters. 2018/11
It is closed to visitors.
We didn't hate this place - it just wasn't open. 2pm on a Saturday in June 2016. Can't see anywhere what the hours are supposed to be.
Excellent!
Disappointingly small and not focused enough on the migration of the Serbs, interaction with other Slavic / Balkan cultures. On the other hand, super inexpensive (~$4USD
A great collocation of national heritage and costumes of all regions! Recommended for Slavists especially!
This museum was recently renovated. We visited 2 weeks ago and loved it.
Beautiful.different periods of culture,life,.on english too.water,toilet,very important.

This museum has clothes, tools, furniture, and recreations of living spaces of Serbian people from the past. They're still working on exhibits today so it's not fully functional completely right now but there are still many things to see in the upper levels.

Very cool museum. Interactive. If you are looking to do it in English make sure to double check the times for guided English tours. They have a very informative 15 minute video at the start. Then the guide will show you all the cool Tesla cooks and engines. Won’t take longer than an hour. Really worth checking out if you are in the city.

A must see when in Belgrade! Nikola Tesla museum is a perfect place to get more familiar with both professional and personal life of one of the biggest scientists and inventors of our World! Be sure to follow the guided tours (there are both in Serbian and English) as guides are professional and full of exceptional stories that will make your visit unforgettable! Strongly recommend!

In my opinion it is the Best place I visited in Belgrade. It is so inspiring to hear the story of one of the greatest scientists. I was amazed by the experiment with the lightning. There are a lot of his personal items there and some of his inventions and most importantly they have Tesla himself (his ashes). I totally recommend it. If you want to go there check first the schedule of the museum(there are Serbian and English tours) and go 20 minutes before the tour in order to get a ticket because you can not book beforehand.

From the outside it looks like a small house and you begin to wonder whether this is a tourist trap. But once you enter and pay the minimal fee, its a place of some serious facts, knowledge and great history. The ticket is also your tour for the time. I honestly havent paid that much attention in months. It was really interesting and at some parts of the tour you get hands on, which really spices the experience up. Our tour guide was fantastic, she was very knowledgeable and was very clear and easy to understand. Definitely worth buying some of the souvenirs at the end, you wont find them anywhere else!
The museum is dedicated to one of the greatest scientists of humanity. There is a guided tour showing many of his projects that had changed the world. Excellent place.

Ivo Andric's home. This is where he lived. There are some rooms left like there were in the past when he was living there. Some interesting personal belongings. Many documents of his life. May of them show how Yugoslavia was back in time. Interesting museum-home and cheap. Worth a shoot
A must. For all good books' lovers.

This is a place where lived Ivo Andrić, writer who won the Nobel prize in literature 1961("for the epic force with which he has traced themes and depicted human destinies drawn from the history of his country.") During the Second World War Andric wrote his three large works, all of which were published in 1945: Na Drini ćuprija(The Bridge on the Drina-), Travnička hronika (Bosnian Story), and Gospođica (The Woman from Sarajevo). He was also diplomat and politician.
Nobel prize winner.
It is hard to explain that feeling of having the chance to actually see the place where great Serbian writer created his best works!
Really great exhibition, there were no other visitors except me:)

Very interesting museum with a lot of information about the various periods in history. There is not a lot of written information in English but there is some kind of mobile application that seems to seems to take care about that. Unfortunately I didn't discover it in time to try it out. More effort and should be put into the civil war of the nineties.
Probably one of the better military meusuems in the world. It's a walkthrough of 2000 years of warfare. Everything from Spears the graphite bombs....

We spent over 4 hours browsing the museum without being aware that much time has passed. Could have easily stayed longer. Would be best to visit with someone from the region for extra translations and explanations as full experience requires some prior history knowledge.

Excibitions from 6th century until New age! Amazing for every man will feel like a boy! Must visit it! From the age of the kings and cavalry unti the age of the today's soldiers! It's a MUST VISIT PLACE!! Easy access and you can walk first all around the castle and then visit this museum! Make sure you have at least 2 hours for this visit because you will find lots of interesting historic things. You will remember this post when you come here believe me!
Really great exhibition, there were no other visitors except me:)

Very interesting museum with a lot of information about the various periods in history. There is not a lot of written information in English but there is some kind of mobile application that seems to seems to take care about that. Unfortunately I didn't discover it in time to try it out. More effort and should be put into the civil war of the nineties.
Probably one of the better military meusuems in the world. It's a walkthrough of 2000 years of warfare. Everything from Spears the graphite bombs....

We spent over 4 hours browsing the museum without being aware that much time has passed. Could have easily stayed longer. Would be best to visit with someone from the region for extra translations and explanations as full experience requires some prior history knowledge.

It's a MUST VISIT PLACE!! Easy access and you can walk first all around the castle and then visit this museum! Make sure you have at least 2 hours for this visit because you will find lots of interesting historic things. You will remember this post when you come here believe me!

One of the biggest collection of historical aircrafts in the world. Amazing static display. The purpose built building could use some TLC but the airplanes always steal the show. If you are an aviation buff check it out if you are flying through Belgrade.
Want to see one of the unique planes in the world, go to this museum. Guide was really good and speaks perfect English.

It’s great piece of history, that unfortunately hasn’t been maintained properly. Still there is few interesting planes to see, definitely worth taking your kids at some point. I wouldn’t recommend visiting in the extreme hot temperatures since the air conditioning is not working, and there is more than few planes that are parked outdoor so one more reason to plan it at the right time of the year.
There is so many good planes like CARAVELLE
The "Lady" that works in gifts shop and cafeteria was totally unapproachable and unhelpful. Museum is excellent but lot's of renovation is needed.

This restaurant is situated on the top floor of the building in very center of Belgrade with excellent views, especially when you sit next to the edge of balcony. But, except for the views, there is nothing much to offer. Food is not so good, service could be much better, if you don't have table with the view, it looks like you're in the basement not on the top of the building. During the winter months, it's cold inside and, therefore, not pleasant at all.
Great views, great service! Food could be improved
great food reasonable prices and great service
Great view, food not quite on the same level.
Great view, nice food, excellent service. Live music is superb. Two thumbs up
Genuine Serbian fast food... That is the way I would describe this place.  If you are looking for a strong and/or spicy genuine Serbian fast food, this is a place for you.
Komplet lepinja mmmmmmmmm:)
The best "komplet lepinja" in the town.
Great serbian food 5☆
Nice catering company. My recommendation for a celebration, birthday or any kind of situation you need good finger food for your guest. The catering is traditional Serbian cuisine.

Excellent food, service, atmosphere.
But the best of all is the live music and of course the singers. The man who plays the keyboard is amazing
Great food and drink for yours gastronomic feeling... ✔️

Serbian traditional food restaurant. Huge portions, mostly grilled meet. 
Quiet and cozzy, across beatifull Manjez park and famous JDP theater, its ideal for families, newcomers to Serbia, who want to taste traditional serbian cuisine.
Not too expensive, in center of town, worth visiting.
Excelent atmosphere in the one of the oldest restaurant in the center of Belgrade 👍🏻👏🏻
Good food, nice ambient, usually good service
Food was great. Unfortunately they allow smoking. There is a no smoking section but one has to walk through smoker paradise in order to get there.
Very friendly staff and tasty food. There are live musicians and the restaurant has an inside non-smoking area as well as a smoking area. Great experience overall.
Great food and service!  I really appreciated a separate non-smoking section (which appears to be a rarity in Belgrade)

Legendary place in Belgrade!!! ONE AND ONLY!!!
Number one - staff: experienced waiters who know what and when guest need (to drink or eat) even before one knows
Number two - garden: the best outdoor seating in Belgrade, in shade of hundred years old tree with sound of fountain... 
Number three - cuisine: whatever order you make, there is no mistake. My personal favorites are cevapi but other things are great as well.
Number four - drink: various choices but always have good choice of rakija (fruit brandy, usually plums) and beer.

Old style restaurant. Real "kafana" with real boem spirit. Excellent service, very tasty and delicious food. Very clean toilets. Live music, but big space. Two orchestra would be better choice for this big space. All recommendations!
Food was great. Unfortunately they allow smoking. There is a no smoking section but one has to walk through smoker paradise in order to get there.
Very friendly staff and tasty food. There are live musicians and the restaurant has an inside non-smoking area as well as a smoking area. Great experience overall.
Great food and service!  I really appreciated a separate non-smoking section (which appears to be a rarity in Belgrade)

Old style restaurant. Real "kafana" with real boem spirit. Excellent service, very tasty and delicious food. Very clean toilets. Live music, but big space. Two orchestra would be better choice for this big space. All recommendations!

The restaurant with many years traditions. You can get to eat everything that you imagine. International, Mediterranean, Italian and Serbian cuisine you can find in one restaurant. The food is very delicious. Cozy place with good live music in evening hours. The staff is perfect, attentive and friendly.
Excellent experience.  Service good. Portions are huge.
Good place for live music😀
Ok
Very good food but service is poor. Waiters are lazy for that kind of restaurant. Very good  Serbian bread. Ask for kaymak for apetizer with hot bread.

Man, some of the best Rostij in Beograd.  Perfect location, easy in and out, close to everything.  Not super fancy and maybe not the absolute best but consistently awesome.  Never fails.  Go to place for all the BBQ delicacies.  Fly to Beograd, take the first taxi to Stepin vajat, make no stops and order double pljeskavica.  You know you want to...
Good food. Really value for money. Would really go again.
Fast, cheap, good quality,  works 24/7. Legendary place to eat in this neighborood, and wider! :)
Good food, great service and great prices.
Very famous fast food known for its good location quickly accessible via highway. Not the best barbecue you will ever eat but they work 24/7.
Tasty food, just enough portions, Zlatarski sir is something you have to try. Poor drink card, too "friendly" personel, kitchen should be completely isolated from the rest of the restaurant.
Nice aambient
Ok
Ok.
Ok

It was a great experience for us. The ambient is cosy and warm. It's a traditional Serbian restaurant. We met a Macedonian born waiter which was a positive surprise. He was very polite and professional. Everything he recommended we ordered, and it was delicious. The prices were more than acceptable.

Very nice Serbian traditional fish restaurant in the countryside, just 10 minute drive out of Belgrade. Local band plays life music (old Serbian songs). You can ask the musicians to come right next to your table and play your favourite song/s.
The karađorđeva schnitzel is great, the cheese cake is also highly recommended.
Unique place. Hidden from the city, but just there by Sava river
Mmmm

Belgrade can be very stressful city. This quite and cozy space with wonderful music it’s something much needed for a pause or some kind of renewing ritual. It may sound crazy but there is spiritual quality in it. 

The place is nice for a launch pause or friendly chat, it’s just 5 tables and self service.

Cute & delicious..
 Not too much healthy food options in Belgrade so this is definitely bull's eye if you're in a search for such fast food

Delicious food and wonderful service. I would recommend everyone who is interested to have a healthy, tasteful and also affordable meal to visit this lovely place. Whatever yo order you will not regret
Cheers
Been coming here since 2012 or 2013, and the quality has always been great. Cozy smoke-free space too.
Great food, good location. inside it's peaceful and you can listen to a nice jazz music.
